info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 7 at 3:18PM EDT until October 7 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Jackson KY
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of east central Kentucky, including the following county, Montgomery.
* WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 318 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Sterling, Jeffersonville, Camargo, Gatewoods Station, Coons Station, Ewington, Levee, Prewitt, Upper Spencer, Howards Mill, Lower Spencer, Klondike, Oggs Station, Stoops, Wades Mill, Stepstone, Judy, Grassy Lick, Bean and Walkers Crossing.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING
